This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:30 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Heather Lynn Koch, Defendant Heather Lynn Koch in court. Atty. Anderson recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 -  Battery with modifier. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and withholds entry of judgment in favor of DJOC for a period of 18 months. Court approves and signs DJOC. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 2 and 3. DE approved to continue payment plan, Court amends current order to $25 per month. Adjourned: 10:39 AM. kma
Filed by DA Karn W. arc

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Settlement conference on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

$750 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sara K. or Michael K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:45 PM  CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood        Heather Lynn Koch appeared. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. DE to contact PD to see if she qualifies for their services. Bond argument. Court orders bond. NG plea. Court sets STC regarding atty status, PSC and SETC.  gll  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
